page.title: 04WILDLIFE RESERVE DONCASTER
page.content: Potteric Carr nature reserve{(location {on page 3)}has a variety of habitats: open water, reed fen, grassland, willow carr, birch-oak woodland on railway embankments and waste tips,flooded oak-birch woodland, limestone railway embankments of birch, hawthorne and brambles and waste ground. These habitats support large numbers of birds, flowers and insects.There are many common waterfowl and less common water rail and reed warbler. Higher areas support owls, woodpeckers, finches and tits. This year a pair of bitterns nested attracting a great deal of interest nationally. Grass snakes, common lizards and butterflies all add to the colour of the area making it one of great interest to naturalists and those seeking peaceful recreation.
